entry.title: speeding-up-angularjs-even-more
entry.content:
We'll agree that AngularJS is awesome. One of the most handy features of the framework is the data-binding mechanism that avoid us to write a lot of code for wiring up our models and views together.

What you should keep in mind is that the data-binding awesomeness is based on $digest cycles, which are a basic dirty checking (if there's a change in the value, then fires the change event).

The $digest cycle

To understand how the $digest cycle works, let's consider the following example:

index.html

``` 

<div ng-controller="MyCtrl">
    <input type="text" placeholder="Name:" ng-model="name">
    <h1>Hello, <h1>
</div>

```

script.js

``` 'use strict';

angular.module('myApp', [])

.controller('MyCtrl', function($scope) {
    $scope.name = 'Ciro';
});

```

The $scope, which is the "glue" between the controller and the view, has a $$watchers list. So every time that a new property is created in the scope or an expression is placed in the view, a new $watcher is added to the list.
